title: (x) Gladiator - (similar to) Palatino, Michelangelo {William, Addison}
content:
i post this earlyer, but the thread is missing so here it is, again ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516051136im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
   
 [http://erydian.com/temp/gladiator.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516051136/http:/erydian.com/temp/gladiator.jpg)   
   
does anyone know the name of that font?
author: eddie

comments.content: Michelangelo, in the metal version, has a U with a stem, which the text here doesn't. Zapf has changed Palatino over the years, making it less mannered. This might be an earlier version than the [current one](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516051136/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/palatino/roman/testdrive.html?s=GLADIATOR&p=72).

You're right, William. It looks like a cross between "foundry" Palatino and Michelangelo. Here are some [earlier Palatino samples](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516051136/http:/cgm.cs.mcgill.ca/~luc/palatino2.html). I haven't found an online sample of Michelangelo yet.

OK, here's a [link to Michelangelo](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516051136/http:/www.bertholdtypes.com/bq_library/090172000.html), but it doesn't help me any. The U, R, and P are different for sure -- I haven't examined it closely, but there are still a lot of similarities.
